name: MAS Boston Society
mission: Tarbiya Department Tarbiya aims at rooting the faith, purifying the soul, expanding and refining knowledge/understanding, developing and refining all aspects of character, boosting commitment, building skills, and instilling the discipline necessary to conduct a successful, fulfilling, meaningful, and balanced life of learning, virtue, commitment, and service of Islam and humanity.
theoryOfChange: Developing God-conscious community servants who can benefit all of society through spiritual development, education, and civic engagement.

grantsData.purpose: MONEY COLLECTED AS PART OF ZAKAT (AN EXPECTATION IN THE MUSLIM FAITH THAT ALL FINANCIALLY STABLE MUSLIMS PAY MONEY TOWARDS HELPING NEEDY INDIVIDUALS IN THE COMMUNITY) IS GIVEN TO THE ISLAMIC CIRCLE OF NORTH AMERICA (ICNA) RELIEF, WHO THEN DISTRIBUTES THIS MONEY BASED ON AN APPLICATION AND REVIEW PROCESS TO NEEDY INDIVIDUALS.

PAYMENT TO ISB (A RELIGOUS ORGANIZATION) FOR ISB TO PAYDOWN LOAN WHICH WAS USED TO FINANCE THE CONTRUCTION OF THE ISLAMIC SOCIETY OF BOSTON CULTURAL CENTER (THE CENTER). THIS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT BETWEEN MAS BOSTON AND ISB FOR THE CENTER.

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 33/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston shows good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://masboston.org/donate (Source: https://masboston.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization is zakat-eligible and provides information on zakat policy.
The organization reported a program expense ratio of 85.3% and holds 3.2 months of working capital.
Donors have multiple giving methods and options to support the organization's mission.
Total revenue was $3,286,832, with fundraising efficiency at $0.05 per $1 raised, supporting programs like Tarbiya and Youth Development.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial efficiency and clear religious alignment, though its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence and limited liquidity reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital reserves are relatively low at 3.2 months
Limited public documentation regarding specific long-term impact metrics and cost-per-beneficiary data

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows high alignment for Muslim donors by maintaining a clear zakat-eligibility policy and focusing on religious and cultural preservation [1]. Its mission to root faith and refine character addresses urgent community needs for spiritual and social development [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: MAS Boston directs 85.3% of its $3,286,832 total revenue toward its core programs, including youth development and civic engagement [2][4]. While the organization demonstrates high financial efficiency in its operations, the impact score reflects a focus on capacity building where direct long-term outcomes are less frequently quantified in public filings [2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the Muslim community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly support community services
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.05 per $1 raised
Strong focus on holistic spiritual development (Tarbiya) and youth leadership
baseline_narrative.summary: MAS Boston is a non-profit organization dedicated to personal and societal reform through its Tarbiya, youth development, and public affairs programs [2][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various community-focused initiatives [1][3].

all_citations.quote: MAS Boston is a Zakat-eligible organization.
Your donation helps us continue our mission.

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial efficiency and clear religious alignment, though its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence and limited liquidity reserves.

areas_for_improvement.context: While financial efficiency is high, there is <cite id="2">limited public documentation</cite> regarding specific outcome metrics or cost-per-beneficiary data.
The organization currently lacks <cite id="2">external evaluations</cite> to verify the long-term effectiveness of its Tarbiya and youth programs.

bbb_assessment.summary: No BBB Wise Giving Alliance assessment is currently available for this organization.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's high program ratio suggests that funds are being utilized for their intended purposes despite the lack of formal impact reports.
risk_factors: <cite id="2">Working capital is slightly below the 6-month ideal</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="2">absence of rigorous impact measurement</cite>, making it difficult to quantify the spiritual or social return on investment.

confidence.notes: Strong historical data but needs updated filings for a higher confidence score.

alignment.explanation: The organization has <cite id="1">high Muslim donor fit</cite> due to its explicit zakat program and focus on <cite id="1">Islamic identity and Tarbiya</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment is already strong; maintaining <cite id="1">clear asnaf-based reporting</cite> will ensure continued donor confidence.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust MAS Boston due to its <cite id="4">transparent reporting of executive compensation</cite> ($91,461 for the top officer) and its long-standing presence in the Boston area. The organization maintains <cite id="4">strong board governance</cite> with seven members overseeing its strategic direction.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="2">seek a full rating from Charity Navigator</cite> by providing more comprehensive impact data.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="4">high program expense ratio of 85.3%</cite> and a capacity-building model that empowers local youth. However, the <cite id="2">evidence of outcomes remains unverified</cite> by third parties.
impact.improvement: The charity could improve its impact score by <cite id="2">publishing annual beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for cost-effectiveness analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Financial transparency without external impact verification

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Supports local mosques and national Islamic organizations to strengthen community infrastructure

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim American Society - MAS Boston empowers the Muslim community through comprehensive spiritual development, youth leadership, and civic engagement.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value regional community building and want to support Islamic spiritual development and youth leadership in the American context.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through a trusted local institution
Believe in the importance of Tarbiya (spiritual growth) for the next generation
Value high financial efficiency and low fundraising overhead
giving_considerations: Donations support a mix of direct programming and grants to other local mosques
Impact is measured more through community presence than quantitative data
The organization is a established regional leader with over 20 years of history
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require rigorous, data-driven evidence of social impact or those looking for international humanitarian relief.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The grade reflects high financial transparency but a <cite id="2">lack of published outcome metrics</cite> or independent evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MAS Boston operates on the theory that by providing <cite id="2">spiritual training (Tarbiya) and civic engagement opportunities</cite>, it can create a more resilient and active Muslim community.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that spiritual and leadership programs are effectively achieving their goals of community reform.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="4">13.4% growth rate</cite> and expanding programs like PACE, the organization has a high capacity to absorb new funding for regional expansion.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Boston, MA and surrounding USA areas

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="4">significant grantmaking activity</cite> to other local Islamic institutions.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Broader national reach vs MAS Boston's regional focus

strengths.detail: The organization allocates <cite id="4">86.0% of its total expenses</cite> directly to its programs, significantly exceeding common industry benchmarks for non-profit efficiency.
MAS Boston demonstrates remarkable fiscal discipline, spending only <cite id="2">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
The charity strengthens the local ecosystem by awarding <cite id="4">$125,000 in grants to the Islamic Society of Boston</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: MAS Boston's financial health is underscored by its ability to maintain <cite id="2">3.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing a resilient buffer for its operations. This stability supports a wide array of initiatives, including the <cite id="2">Arkanum and Youth Development programs</cite>, which are central to its mission of fostering leadership. The organization's revenue model is diversified, with <cite id="4">$796,962 generated from program service revenue</cite>, reducing its total reliance on pure donations and suggesting a sustainable service-delivery model.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim American Society (MAS) Boston serves as a cornerstone for the New England Muslim community, focusing on personal development and societal reform through its comprehensive Tarbiya department. The organization reported <cite id="4">$3,286,832 in total revenue</cite> for the 2018 tax year, reflecting its significant scale as a regional institution. MAS Boston operates with high financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 85.3%</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions are directed toward its core mission of spiritual and leadership development. Beyond internal programming, the organization acts as a community anchor, providing <cite id="4">$154,532 in domestic grants</cite> to key local partners like the Islamic Society of Boston. Its programming is diverse, ranging from <cite id="2">Public Affairs & Civic Engagement (PACE)</cite> to specialized youth development and convert support services. As a <cite id="1">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, it provides a verified channel for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations, specifically serving the <cite id="1">fuqara and masakin</cite> categories. The organization has demonstrated consistent financial expansion, achieving a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 13.4%</cite>, indicating a healthy growth trajectory and increasing community trust.
